conclusion: A drives in from the lower right direction towards the group of blocks.
The image shows a group of blocks of different colors (yellow, green, red, blue, orange) arranged on a green surface. A is positioned in the lower-right corner and is moving toward the blocks.
A’s path from the lower-right corner takes it straight toward the orange two-block stack that sits furthest right in the cluster.
The front face of the vehicle meets the large orange base cube almost head-on, so the first contact is with that cube.
Immediately afterward, A collides with the small orange cube that is resting on top of the large orange base cube.
The small orange cube is light and perched high; it is knocked off and falls forward a short distance.
The larger orange cube (heavier) slides a few centimetres toward the centre of the layout but does not topple.
No other blocks are close enough or in line to be hit; therefore nothing else moves.
Because the base cube absorbs most of the momentum (heavier + direct hit), the vehicle loses nearly all of its speed on that first collision.
The vehicle rolls only a few centimetres farther, coming to rest directly against the now-shifted large orange cube.
The vehicle’s final position is slightly left of its original course, directly beside the large orange cube, just inside the main cluster.
A collides only with the two orange blocks; it stops right beside the large orange cube.
